definition: The date by which outstanding requirements or additional information must be provided to continue or complete the suitability review.
The date the CanSell validation process was completed or closed. Populated when the validation reaches a final state.
The date the suitability review was finalized, whether approved, declined, or marked not applicable.
The date the document review was completed or closed. Populated when the review reaches a final state.
The date the funding process was completed or closed. Populated when all funding sources reach a final state.
Query parameter for when a completed or cancelled policy is to drop off
When a completed or cancelled policy is to drop off
The producer’s legal first name as registered with licensing authorities.
The party’s legal first name as registered with the carrier or licensing authorities.
Indicator that at least one section requires action
Flags whether any actions are required by the carrier, distributor, or producer before CanSell validation can move forward or be considered complete.
Flags whether any additional actions are required (from the producer, distributor, or carrier) before the suitability review can proceed or reach a final decision.
Flags whether any action is required before the document review can continue or be finalized. May indicate missing pages, clarification required, or forms that need corrections.
Flags whether any action is required from the producer, client, or carrier to move the funding process forward.
Indicator that at least one section requires action
Indicates whether the application passed suitability review when the status is completed. A value of true denotes approval; false denotes the application was declined based on suitability findings.
A list of specific issues identified during the CanSell validation review that must be resolved before the producer is considered eligible to sell. Each object in the array represents one issue.
A list of specific issues identified during the review. Each issue object represents one item that must be corrected, clarified, or provided by the producer or client.
The CRD number associated with the affected producer, typically used for registered representatives. Included only when relevant to the issue.
The National Producer Number (NPN) for the producer affected by the issue. Included when issues relate to a specific individual producer rather than the application as a whole.
The tax identification number of the affected producer, used when the issue pertains to identity or licensing validation tied to tax ID records.
The deadline by which the outstanding form or required correction must be submitted to move the application forward.
The name of the form associated with the issue. Used when the issue pertains to a specific document.
The identifier or internal number of the form tied to the issue. Provides additional precision in identifying which form requires action.
Free-form explanation providing additional details about the issue, such as what is missing, why it failed, or steps required to resolve it.
Free-form details explaining the issue, the correction needed, or any clarifying context helpful to the producer or back office team.
Categorizes the reason the issue was flagged. Helps standardize review feedback—for example, identifying missing signatures or incomplete forms.
allowedValues: Enum: applicationIssue, contactCarrier, incompleteForm, missingForm, missingSignature, needClarity, other

definition: Categorizes the issue discovered during validation. Used to standardize issue tracking and allow automated resolution or routing. Required for any issue object.
allowedValues: Enum: trainingIncompleteMissing, trainingExpired, agentNotAppointedForSale, jitAppointmentInProgress, agentNotLicensed, other.  Required for any issues object in the array

definition: The producer’s legal last name as registered with licensing authorities.
The party’s legal last name as registered with the carrier or licensing authorities.
Additional context, comments, or carrier-provided details about the CanSell review. Intended for free-form explanations that do not fit into the structured fields.
Free-form field for supplementary comments, carrier explanations, or suitability reviewer notes that provide context beyond the structured fields.
A free-form field for reviewer notes, comments, or additional context relating to the overall document review.
Free-form comments or additional context regarding the overall funding process.

National Producer Number assigned to the individual, used for tracking licensing and appointments.
National Producer Number assigned to the entity, if applicable, for tracking licensing and appointments.

allowedValues: Enum: asc, desc; Default desc

definition: A list of all funding sources associated with the application. Each object in the array represents a separate funding source.
The expected amount of funds to be received from this funding source.
Identifier for the account, policy, or contract at the ceding company that is the source of funds.
The method used to initiate the funding request with the ceding company. Helps with audit and workflow tracking.
allowedValues: Enum: fax, email, mail, ups, fedEx, dtccRpl, dtccAttachments, other

definition: Name of the ceding company from which funds are being transferred. Required for transfers involving another insurer or financial institution.
The date by which the next action is expected, such as follow-up with the ceding company or posting of funds.
Free-form notes providing context about the ceding company, the transfer, or special instructions.
Reference or tracking number associated with the funding request, such as FedEx number, fax confirmation, or DTCC RPL ID.
pattern: Based off Method of Initiation Example: FedEx Number, Fax Number, DTCC RPL ID etc

definition: The date the funding request was sent to the ceding company. Used for tracking response times.
The date the funding is considered effective for contract purposes, which may differ from the received date.
Flags whether any action is required for this specific funding source, such as submitting missing documentation or follow-up with a ceding company.
The method by which the funds are being transferred. Helps standardize processing and reconciliation.
allowedValues: Enum: anotherPolicy, check, clearinghouse, creditCard, debitCard, digitalPayment, electronicFundTransfer, payrollDeduction, wireTransfer

definition: Free-form details regarding this funding source, such as clarifications, instructions, or issues not captured elsewhere.
Provides a standardized reason when a funding source is delayed or requires attention. Helps categorize exceptions and next steps.
allowedValues: Enum: awaitingFundsFromCedingCompany, contactTheCarrier, fundingDiscrepancy, nigoAtCedingCarrier, noFundsReceivedCash, pendingReg60, other

definition: The actual amount of funds received for this source. Useful for reconciliation and discrepancy tracking.
The date the funds were received. Populated when funds are successfully posted.
Indicates the status of this funding source within the funding workflow.
allowedValues: Enum: inProgress, complete

definition: The type of funding transaction, providing context on whether funds are contributions, rollovers, exchanges, or transfers.
allowedValues: Enum: contribution, directRollover, employeeContribution, employerContribution, full1035Exchange, indirectRollover, nonQualifiedTransferOfAssets, partial1035Exchange, qualifiedTransfer

definition: The date the CanSell validation process began or was first triggered. Useful for process tracking and measuring review duration.
The date the suitability review process was initiated. Used for tracking processing times and audit visibility.
The date the document review process began or was first initiated. Used for audit and processing time tracking.
The date the funding process was initiated or first triggered. Useful for tracking processing times.

allowedValues: Enum: received, inProgress, completed, cancelled
Enum: received, inProgress, completed, cancelled

definition: Indicates the current state of the CanSell validation process for the producer or application. This reflects where the review stands in the workflow—whether it has not yet been reviewed, is actively being evaluated, or has been fully validated.
allowedValues: Enum: awaitingReview, inProgress, completed

definition: Indicates the current state of the suitability review for the application. Represents where the application is in the suitability workflow—waiting to be reviewed, actively under evaluation, completed, or deemed not applicable based on product type or state requirements.
allowedValues: Enum: awaitingReview, inProgress, completed, notApplicable

definition: Indicates the current stage of the document review process. Reflects where the review stands—waiting to begin, currently being evaluated, or fully completed.
allowedValues: Enum: awaitingReview, inProgress, completed

definition: Indicates the current overall status of the funding process for the application or contract. Reflects whether funding is awaiting review, in progress, or fully completed.
allowedValues: Enum: awaitingReview, inProgress, completed
Enum: received, inProgress, completed, cancelled

The tax identification number of the entity, used for regulatory reporting and identification.
